data.title: Tests for custom TM theme settings
data.body:
Test for #11095
- [x] Any OS - @bgashler1 

Complexity 3
## Set up
- Clone the repository [VS Code Extension Samples](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples)
- Open VS Code on **theme-sample**
- Run the extension using Launch Extension. 

This will show Sample theme in themes selection dialog

Open **Sample_Dark.tmTheme** and **Sample_Light.tmTheme** files and play around with different colors for following settings
- rangeHighlight
- findMatch
- currentFindMatch
- selectionHighlight
- wordHighlight
- wordHighlightStrong

Make sure that editor picks up above colors when above themes are selected

data.title: Implements whitespace rendering for "boundary" and "all" modes.
data.body:
Implements #3828 partially, selection rendering is entirely separate from the actual content in the editor. Would be difficult to render whitespace for only what is selected.

Also removed the View->Toggle Render Whitespace button, as it didn't seem like it would fit as it would now not be a toggle. Not sure where it would be suitable to place the new menu options, if they are to be placed at all.

data.title: Test: Support other sorting orders in the extensions viewlet
data.body:

Complexity 2
Tests  #8022

Under the `...` dropdown menu of the Extensions viewlet you'll now find sorting options.

data.title: Test: Improve extension bulk update story
data.body:
- [x] any OS **@isidorn**
- [x] any OS **@sandy081**

Complexity 2
Tests #8124 
## 

There is now an action to update all extensions under the `...` actions of the extension viewlet.

Also, there is an `extensions.autoUpdate` setting which will automatically update extensions when detected that they are out of date.

data.title: Cannot exit visual studio

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: `1.4.0` - OS Version: `10.11.6 (15G31)` Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open Terminal 2. run `code .` 3. quit visual studio 4. dock still shows icon and cannot `force quit`, it even blocks restart because process cannot be killed but there are no more processes named `code` or `code helper` in the `Activity Monitor`

- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Press Green play button.
2. Get Error - Cannot launch debug target (spawn node ENOENT).

Node - v4.2.1
ESLint - v3.4.0

VSCode extension versions
![screen shot 2016-08-29 at 12 42 31 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1039491/18057360/1335fbfc-6de6-11e6-9fda-97b89da9b2a2.png)

data.title: Rename lineHighlight to rangeHighlight
data.body:
In editor we have following feature using lineHighlight decoration 
### Find

Decorating for line (s) containing find matches
### Go to symbol

Decorating line (s) of selected symbol
### Go to line

Decorating requested line

TM themes already use this key for highlighting current line. In order to expose this as tm theme setting, we need a unique and proper key. Looking at the above usages we can call this rangeHighlight.

This PR is to rename lineHighlight to rangeHighlight

data.title: Quick open: resolveHandler() being called often and complicated?
data.body:
I am a bit puzzled why we call `resolveHandler` in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/quickopen/quickOpenController.ts many more times than we used to and why there is such a complicated logic to handle this.

As a reference here is how it used to work: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/1.4.0/src/vs/workbench/browser/parts/quickopen/quickOpenController.ts#L835

data.title: Test lazy WorkspaceSymbolProvider
data.body:
- [x] any **@joaomoreno**

tests #890

Test that you can now implement a 'lazy' workspace symbol provider. That is one that returns incomplete symbol information but offering a `resolve` method that is invoked when a symbol is selected in the UI.

data.title: Add an option to prevent copying an empty selection

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Like the title says, when nothing is selected, copying shouldn't copy a blank character.

data.title: Test completion enhancements
data.body:
- [x] any os **@joaomoreno**

tests #6874

We enriched the suggest API such that suggestions are now able to specific additional text edits and an additional command to run. Test that thing work as you would expect them to work.

data.title: Test cancelable input/quick pick
data.body:
- [x] any os **@bpasero**

tests #9377

The calls for `showInputBox` and `showQuickPick` now allow to pass in a cancellation token that hides them again. Test that cancelling programmatically yields the same results as manually (promise resolves to `undefined`).

data.title: C color coding stops after line with specific syntax
data.body:
[foo.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/442500/foo.zip)
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.5.0-insider (92d3324e3d05a6d2b765c08651d89e9ec1d19f4c, 2016-08-29T06:09:51.858Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Unzip attached file
2. Open included foo.c
3. Goto line 93. All code after that line is not colored.

All extensions were disabled

Same behavior also occurs with standard Visual Studio Code Version 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679)

data.title: Test: new setting to include symbols in quick open
data.body:
- [x] any OS **@sandy081**

With https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4512 there is a new setting `search.quickOpen.includeSymbols` to include symbols in quick open (`Cmd+P`) search.
Verify:
- by default this is disabled and file results are coming in fast and reliable
- when enabled you also see symbol results coming in (as with 1.4) but now we are waiting for the results to actually come in and not cancel the symbol search after an arbitrary timeout

data.title: Support msdepoy/publishsettings
data.body: VS Code should support MS Deploy & publishsettings files, webmatrix users are directed to VS.Code, and are unable easily work with Azure app services as a result of the lack of support.

data.title: Fix lists in hover widget
Test: ESLint
data.body:
Test for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/issues/79
Complexity: 3
- [x] any OS - **@isidorn**
- [x] any OS - **@roblourens**

The module resolving algorithm to load the eslint library has been re-implemented. It now looks for the eslint module in the parent folder of the workspace folder as well. Frist install this ESLint extension 
[vscode-eslint-1.0.1.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/443428/vscode-eslint-1.0.1.zip) as a side extension (**Note** you have to the zip to vsix). Then test from a workspace folder:
- that the eslint is correctly loaded from the workspace folder or any parent folder.
- that the eslint library is correctly loaded from a global npm location as well.
- install eslint lib at a custom location and point the setting eslint.nodePath value to it (if installed in a node_modules folder the node_modules name must be part of the path). Ensure that the eslint library can be loaded.
- install an eslint plugin and configure it in the .eslintrc.json file accordingly. Ensure that the eslint plugin gets loaded correctly as well as long as it is installed at the same 'location' (e.g. node_modules folder) as eslint library itself.

data.title: Fall back to read contributes.configuration?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10

I have an [extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=formulahendry.code-runner) which will read the contributes.configuration called "code-runner.executorMap". (GitHub repo: https://github.com/formulahendry/vscode-code-runner)
By default, it is like below:

``` json
"code-runner.executorMap": {
    "javascript": "node",
    "php": "php",
    "python": "python",
    "perl": "perl",
    "ruby": "ruby",
    "go": "go run",
    "lua": "lua",
    "groovy": "groovy",
    "powershell": "powershell -ExecutionPolicy ByPass -File",
    "bat": "",
    "shellscript": "bash",
    "fsharp": "fsi",
    "csharp": "scriptcs",
    "vbscript": "cscript //Nologo"
}
```

After I remove the `"javascript": "node"` in User Settings or Workspace Setting, the extension could still read the `"javascript": "node"`. I am not sure if I read config incorrectly?
Code snippet is like below:

``` javascript
this._config = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('code-runner');
let executorMap = this._config.get<any>('executorMap');
let executor = executorMap['javascript'];
```

Actual:
The value of 'executor' is still 'node'
Expect:
The value of 'executor' should be 'undefined'
